shortlist.name: Hierarchy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.8 Exchange
shortlist.rationale: Comes in off a win last time out and has shown consistent form with multiple top-three finishes recently. Connections are reliable, and current odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline in recent runs, suggesting peak condition.

shortlist.name: Tyger Bay
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.1 Exchange
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes two wins in last five starts, indicating ability to score at this level. Odds are competitive, and the horse has proven itself over similar conditions. Connections are solid and the horse is holding form.

shortlist.name: Talk Of New York
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 8/15 (1.64 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections (Appleby/Buick), is very strongly supported in the market, and faces mostly exposed or unproven rivals. Lack of public form is typical for a well-regarded debutant from this yard at Kempton. Market confidence and connections suggest readiness and ability.

shortlist.name: Go Rimbaud
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 85/40 (4.2 exchange), clear of the rest.
shortlist.rationale: Solid debut fourth for top yard, likely to improve with experience. Proven ability to handle race conditions and distance. Connections are highly capable with similar types, and the market positions him as the only realistic threat to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Moonlit Surf
shortlist.odds_note: Favoured at 5/4 (SBK), 2.38 (exchange); clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as favourite, representing a top trainer-jockey combination. Connections suggest readiness and ability, and lack of form is not a negative for a debutant in this context. No major improvement needed, and profile fits typical Kempton Park winner.

shortlist.name: Alarming
shortlist.odds_note: Joint favourite at 5/4 (SBK), 2.66 (exchange); solid market position.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a second and fourth, indicating reliability and potential for further improvement. Trainer and jockey are in strong form, and odds reflect genuine winning chance. No evidence of decline, and previous runs suggest suitability for this level.

shortlist.name: Military Cross (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Very short odds (3/10 SBK, 1.3 exchange); clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent runner with two consecutive runner-up finishes, representing top connections (Buick/Gosden). The horse has shown reliable form and is expected to improve further. The market strongly supports his chance, indicating high confidence from both bookmakers and exchange layers.

shortlist.name: Bahadur
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in the market (3/1 SBK, 5.4 exchange); clear gap to outsiders.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with three consecutive third-place finishes and a prior fifth, indicating reliability at this level. While not yet a winner, Bahadur is the only runner with form figures suggesting regular competitiveness and is the only plausible threat to the favorite based on current odds and recent form.

shortlist.name: Dandy G Boy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.3 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two solid runs in last four starts. Proven at this level and trip, and retains top jockey booking. Market leader with no need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Penelope Valentine
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.6 exchange (well-backed, second/third choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner two starts ago and followed up with a respectable fourth. Improving profile, holding form, and connections in good order. Odds reflect genuine chance.

shortlist.name: Ottawa
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.4 exchange (firmly in the market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Placed in last two starts, showing consistency at this level. No major negatives in profile, and odds indicate strong market respect. Should be competitive again.

shortlist.name: Kitaro Kich (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 13/8 (2.7 exchange), indicating strong support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes in last two starts, suggesting readiness to win. Proven at this level and trip, and connections are in good form. Market confidence is notable.

shortlist.name: Enpassant (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 3/1 (4.4 exchange), solid value among principals.
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner two starts back and generally consistent at this grade. Rossa Ryan is a positive jockey booking. Should be competitive if repeating best recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Warrior King (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 5/4 (SBK), 2.46 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, placed second last time out indicating readiness to win. Top connections and clear market leader, suggesting strong confidence from punters and bookmakers. No need for major improvement to feature.

shortlist.name: Gemmari
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite; 15/8 (SBK), 3.1 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, showing clear progression and adaptability. Trained by a top yard and partnered by a capable jockey. Odds reflect strong support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Blue Train (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 8/11 SBK, 1.81 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and multiple placings, including a win last time out. Top connections and clear market leader. No signs of decline and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Buxted Too
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice; 15/4 SBK, 7 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Has competitive form at this class, with a win and several respectable finishes earlier in the season. Jockey/trainer combo is strong for this grade. Odds indicate solid market support.

shortlist.name: Return To Unit
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support (5/2 SBK, 3.7 exchange), clear second favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a solid second last time out, representing a top yard in Roger Varian. The form suggests improvement and readiness, and the odds indicate strong market confidence. Connections are reliable at this level.

shortlist.name: Goodwood Mogul
shortlist.odds_note: Joint favourite (5/2 SBK, 3.9 exchange), consistent support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with multiple recent top-three finishes, indicating reliability and fitness. Marcus Tregoning is adept with this type, and Billy Loughnane is a strong booking. The horse is proven at the class and distance, and odds reflect genuine winning chance.

shortlist.name: Canopus (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid third choice (4/1 SBK, 5.6 exchange), not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Placed in last two starts, showing steady form and knocking on the door for a win. Ed Walker’s runners often improve with experience, and Shoemark is a capable rider. The odds offer value for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Ziata
shortlist.odds_note: Strong odds-on favourite (4/7 SBK, 1.65 exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Ziata is a clear market leader, indicating strong confidence from both bookmakers and the exchange. The recent fourth-place finish should not be underestimated, as in flat racing the margin between fourth and the winner can be minimal, especially if the horse was running over an unsuitable trip or needed the experience. The Ed Walker yard is in good form, and Kieran Shoemark is a reliable jockey booking. Ziata's profile suggests she is the most likely improver in this field and does not require major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Iceni Queen
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite (4/1 SBK, 5.9 exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Iceni Queen also finished fourth on debut, representing the powerful Gosden stable with a top young jockey. The market rates her the only plausible threat to the favourite, and her connections are known for improving horses from first to second start. She does not need major improvement to be competitive and is the clear alternative to the favourite on both form and odds.

shortlist.name: Parisian Scholar
shortlist.odds_note: 6/5 SBK, 2.66 exchange (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, progressive profile, and top connections. Recent victories suggest improvement and readiness. Odds reflect strong market support and form consistency.

shortlist.name: Bearin Up (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 8.2 exchange (solid value, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win two starts back and placed efforts. Proven ability at this level and distance. Trainer/jockey combination reliable for placing horses in competitive handicaps.

shortlist.name: Blooming Legend (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 8.8 exchange (competitive odds, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent, regularly in the frame, with two wins and recent placed efforts. Connections in good form and horse is proven at the trip. Profile fits well for a competitive showing.

shortlist.name: Gamrai
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.55 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a second from last two starts, representing top connections. Recent form is strong and consistent, and the odds reflect clear market confidence. No signs of regression and should be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Mr Alan
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 6.6 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer at this level, regularly hitting the frame. Recent form figures show reliability and competitiveness. Odds indicate respect from the market, and no major improvement is required to contend.

shortlist.name: Rock N Roll Pinkie
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.7 Exchange (solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings, showing reliability at this level. Odds indicate strong market confidence, and connections are in good current form.

shortlist.name: Senor Cortez (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6 Exchange (well-backed, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two consecutive wins, suggesting peak form. Recent improvement and competitive odds make him a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Moonjid
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.82 exchange (clear market leader)
shortlist.rationale: Moonjid is the strongest on recent form, consistently placing and showing improvement in competitive handicaps. The horse is trained by Michael Appleby, a proven operator at this level, and gets a top jockey in Tudhope. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Grey Phoenix (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6.6 exchange (solid second choice)
shortlist.rationale: Grey Phoenix has been consistently close up in recent starts, indicating reliability and readiness to win. Hollie Doyle is a top jockey booking, and the horse is trained by an in-form dual trainer partnership. Odds are competitive and suggest genuine market support.

shortlist.name: Dovey Moon
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 (SBK), 4.2 (Exchange) – clear market leader
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with multiple recent wins and placings, indicating strong current form. Odds reflect solid market support and suggest she is expected to be highly competitive. Connections are reliable at this grade.

shortlist.name: Zouligan
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 (SBK), 5.5 (Exchange) – second choice in the market
shortlist.rationale: Has been running consistently in similar company and now gets a top jockey booking. While not a prolific winner, recent form figures show steady improvement and the odds indicate respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Westgate Warrior
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6.2 exchange (solid market support, clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in best recent form of the field, with a strong second last time out and progressive profile. Odds indicate strong market confidence and connections are in form. No need for major improvement to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Yazaman (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6.6 exchange (well supported, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this grade, regularly placing and running respectably. Trainer and jockey combination is reliable. Recent form is solid and odds reflect realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Mrs Trump (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 7.2 exchange (third in market, not overlooked)
shortlist.rationale: Recent wins two and three starts ago show ability at this level. Last run can be forgiven given prior consistency. Stable in good form and odds are fair for a proven winner.

shortlist.name: Destination Dubai (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/9 (SBK), 1.24 (exchange) – clear, strong favourite
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with three wins from last four starts, including a win on latest reappearance. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level. Odds are very short but fully justified by the profile and lack of credible opposition.

shortlist.name: Herja (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 (SBK), 6.8 (exchange) – clear second choice in the market
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent placings and a win two starts ago. Reliable profile, top jockey booked, and represents the only realistic threat to the favourite. Solid each-way or place claims if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Anaconda (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/5 SBK, 1.8 Exchange (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner with progressive form, representing top dual trainers. Odds reflect strong market confidence and form profile is superior to rivals, with a win last time out indicating peak condition.

shortlist.name: Genbu
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.5 Exchange (solid second choice)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer, always in the frame, and rates as the main danger to the favourite. Connections are reliable at this level and odds offer reasonable value for a horse with proven consistency.

shortlist.name: Primoz (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/4 (exchange 2.42), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Returned with a solid 2nd after a break, has winning form at this level, and represents a top stable in excellent form. The market support and recent run suggest peak fitness and reliability.

shortlist.name: Torneo (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 9/4 (exchange 3.75), well clear of outsiders.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile last season with multiple wins and places, only blemish a fall when still competitive. Returns for a respected yard and has the form to challenge the favourite if fit.

shortlist.name: Evaluation
shortlist.odds_note: 9/5 SBK, 3.0 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with recent placed efforts and a strong win record last season. Connections are in form and the horse is proven at the trip. Odds reflect strong market confidence and he does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Caelan (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.6 exchange (well-supported second favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and top connections. Improving with each start and has the right profile for further progress. Odds are fair for a lightly raced improver from a respected yard.

shortlist.name: Saligo Bay (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.1 exchange (solid third choice, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two wins and a place from last three starts. Proven stamina and consistency at this level. Market respect and recent form suggest another bold showing is likely.

shortlist.name: Magistrato (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 4/6 (1.73 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Magistrato (Fr) arrives in peak form, having won his last two starts and showing consistent recent figures. The current odds reflect strong market confidence, and the combination of a top jockey and a trainer in form further boosts his profile. No signs of decline or need for major improvement, and his profile fits the typical winner's pattern: recent wins, fitness, and strong connections.

shortlist.name: Tees Comp's Clive
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.7 exchange (market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in handicaps, regularly finishing in the frame. Current odds indicate strong market support. Connections are reliable at this level and the horse is fit and holding form, making him a solid contender.

shortlist.name: Kiss My Face
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6 exchange (well-supported, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with recent form figures showing competitiveness in similar company. Odds reflect market respect. Trainer and jockey have a good record in this grade, and the horse is reliable at this level.

shortlist.name: Thank You Blue
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6 exchange (market principal, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability to win at this level and remains competitive in recent starts. Odds suggest strong market confidence. Connections are capable, and the horse is proven in similar handicaps.

shortlist.name: Secret Trix
shortlist.odds_note: 4/9 (SBK), 1.6 (exchange) – clear favourite, very short price
shortlist.rationale: Secret Trix is the standout on recent form, consistently placing and running well in higher grade company. The horse is trained by Olly Murphy, who has a strong record with similar types, and is partnered by Sean Bowen, a top jockey. The odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest the horse is expected to win barring mishap. No major improvement is needed based on current form and class.

shortlist.name: Old Gregorian
shortlist.odds_note: 6/4 (SBK), 2.5 (exchange) – clear second choice, solid support
shortlist.rationale: Old Gregorian has solid recent form, including wins and placings, and is trained by a high-profile partnership. The horse is not an outsider and has shown ability to compete at this level. The odds indicate genuine market respect, and the form profile suggests the horse is reliable and does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Galway Reel (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.85 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, winning last time out after a consistent campaign. Recent form figures show upward trajectory and ability to handle adversity (unseated two back, rebounded strongly). Trainer Ian Williams is respected at this level and the market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Grillon De Monty (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.7 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives off a win and has two victories in last four starts, indicating strong current form. Has shown ability to win after a break and to bounce back from lesser efforts. Consistency and recent improvement make him a leading contender.

shortlist.name: George Darling (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.8 exchange (joint second favourite, market respect)
shortlist.rationale: Progressed well at the end of last campaign, finishing second then winning. Although returning from a break, the trainer is adept at readying horses fresh. Market support suggests fitness is not a concern and prior form is competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Superstylin (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.25 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a win last time, showing ability to go well fresh and confirming previous consistent form. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level. No major negatives in profile and market confidence is notable.

shortlist.name: Loaded And Locked (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 11/10 (SBK), 2.2 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Harry Cobden riding for Emma Lavelle. Current odds indicate clear market support and suggest he is expected to be ready first time out. No form shown, but the market confidence and connections are significant positives.

shortlist.name: Typhoon Warrior (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 10/3 (SBK), 5.7 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Dan Skelton is a leading trainer at Worcester and often targets these races. Market position is solid, and while no form is shown, the stable/jockey combination is highly respected at this level.

shortlist.name: Western Cross (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in market at 9/2 (SBK), 5.7 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: From a strong yard with a good record at the track. Market support is notable and suggests ability. No form shown, but connections and odds indicate a likely contender.

shortlist.name: Big Ginge (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 10/11 SBK, 1.97 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placed form last season, regularly finishing second and third at this level. Returns after a break but has shown reliability and ability to handle similar company. Top connections and market support indicate strong chance.

shortlist.name: Milan Tino (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice; 16/5 SBK, 5.1 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Solid placed form in competitive races, including third and sixth in higher grade. Recent form suggests fitness and ability to contend. Trainer and jockey combination is respected, and odds reflect genuine win chance.

shortlist.name: Axel Bleue
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 6/4 SBK, 2.66 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and two seconds, indicating reliability and peak condition. Connections are solid, and current odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline, and profile fits a likely winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Colin Hobbs
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite; 7/2 SBK, 6.6 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections and is well found in the market. Recent form is not as strong as Axel Bleue but has shown ability and could improve for the yard. Odds suggest respect from bookmakers, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Orange Diamond (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.85 exchange (joint-favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three consecutive wins, indicating clear progression and fitness. The combination of a top amateur jockey and an in-form trainer adds confidence. Odds reflect strong market confidence and are justified by recent dominance at this level.

shortlist.name: Jorebel (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.5 exchange (joint-favourite, solid support)
shortlist.rationale: Has won both starts this season, showing marked improvement and consistency. Trainer and jockey are a proven combination. Recent form figures suggest the horse is still on the upgrade, and odds are fair for a progressive profile.

shortlist.name: Vitorio Piel (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 8/13 SBK, 1.83 exchange (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Won last start, representing top connections in Emmet Mullins. Current odds indicate strong market confidence and form is progressive. No signs of decline and profile fits for this class.

shortlist.name: Gameball (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/5 SBK, 3.9 exchange (solid second choice)
shortlist.rationale: Last-time winner for a leading yard. Odds are competitive and suggest genuine support. Recent form is strong and connections are reliable at this venue.

shortlist.name: Galileo Springs (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.8 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form, having won last time out and consistently placed in previous starts. Connections are strong and the horse is proven at this level. Odds reflect solid support and value for a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Flidais (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 5 exchange (well-supported, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner who has shown progressive form and improvement through the season. Connections are in good order and the odds indicate market respect. No need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Spick And Span (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 4.7 exchange (firmly in the market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent placings and a win two starts back. Form is reliable and the horse is holding condition well. Odds are competitive for a runner with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Avalo (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.85 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placings and a win in the last seven starts. Connections are in good order, and the horse is holding form well, suggesting reliability at this level. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and value for a runner with proven consistency.

shortlist.name: Serienmond (Ger)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.7 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner two starts back and trained by a respected yard. Although the latest run was below best, the overall profile is progressive and the odds are fair for a horse with proven winning ability at this level.

shortlist.name: King Of Kingsfield (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with three wins in last five starts, including a recent victory. Top connections in Elliott and Kennedy. Favourable odds for a horse in peak form and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Birdie Or Bust (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out and placed in two of last three. Trainer and jockey are both in form. Slightly longer odds than favourite but still represents value given recent improvement and strong connections.

shortlist.name: Western Fold (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.78 exchange (solid 2nd fav, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with four consecutive wins, indicating peak form and strong upward trajectory. Trained by Gordon Elliott, a leading yard, and partnered by a capable jockey. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance. No evidence of needing major improvement; already proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Heart Wood (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/4 SBK, 2.6 exchange (fav, clear market leader)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with high-class connections. Recent form figures show reliability at this level, and market support as favourite is justified. Trained by Henry de Bromhead, indicating strong preparation. No major negatives in profile; should be in the mix.

shortlist.name: Croke Park (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.4 exchange (third choice, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Multiple wins last season and placed at a higher level. Recent form slightly below peak but remains competitive in this grade. Top connections (Elliott/Kennedy) and odds indicate respect in the market. Does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Aurea Fortuna (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 11/10 (2.3 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, having won two starts back and placed last time. Consistent profile, proven at this level, and top amateur jockey booked. Connections are reliable in these events. Market support is significant.

shortlist.name: He Fitz In (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 4/1 (5.1 exchange), clear of outsiders.
shortlist.rationale: Recent third suggests return to form, and previous placed efforts indicate ability at this grade. Represents a stable capable of readying one for this type of contest. Solid each-way claims if favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Takiwatanga (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 (SBK), 3.3 (Exchange) – clear market leader
shortlist.rationale: Solid debut third in a race that has worked out well, representing a shrewd yard with a strong record in bumpers. The market support is significant, and the horse is open to improvement on just its second start.

shortlist.name: Maverick Mack (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 (SBK), 3.6 (Exchange) – strong second choice in betting
shortlist.rationale: Debuts for a top stable renowned for readying bumper winners. The lack of form is offset by strong connections and notable market respect, suggesting ability at home.

shortlist.name: Westminster Night (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top local trainer with strong recent strike rate at Nantes. Tony Piccone is a reliable jockey for this yard. Market support suggests stable confidence and connections are in form.

shortlist.name: Ahlain
shortlist.odds_note: Solidly backed, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Cristian Demuro is a leading rider in France and Baratti's runners have performed well at this level. Early odds indicate respect from bookmakers, suggesting readiness and ability.

shortlist.name: Un Instant (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in market, considered a contender.
shortlist.rationale: Anthony Crastus is a proven big-race jockey and Perret's stable is known for placing horses well at Nantes. Market position implies strong chance and connections are reliable.

shortlist.name: Lueur Du Large (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the Peltier stable, a respected local yard with a strong record at Nantes. Early market support and positive connections suggest readiness despite lack of published form. No evidence of needing major improvement.
shortlist.confidence: Solid contender based on connections and market position.

shortlist.name: Luigi De Lafayette (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: From the Grall yard, which is often competitive in these Nantes contests. Market respect and no negative indicators in connections or profile. No sign of being outclassed or needing significant improvement.
shortlist.confidence: Strong chance given stable profile and market support.

shortlist.name: La Belle Histoire (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the betting, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Dubourg runners are typically well-prepared for local targets. Early odds indicate confidence from the market. No evidence of poor form or need for major improvement.
shortlist.confidence: Likely to be competitive; respected on connections and market.

shortlist.name: Majestika (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Gabriel Leenders, who is in strong form at Nantes. Market support suggests stable confidence. Leenders-trained runners often well-prepared for autumn jumps fixtures.

shortlist.name: King D'alene (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in market, respected stable.
shortlist.rationale: Stablemate to Majestika, also from the Leenders yard, which is known for targeting these races. Zuliani is a reliable jockey for the stable, and the horse is well found in the market.

shortlist.name: Kap Lord (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market position, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Dubourg-trained runners are often competitive at Nantes, and Kilian Dubourg is a capable rider. Early odds indicate respect from bookmakers, suggesting readiness and stable confidence.

shortlist.name: L'epopee Allen (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early markets; strong support on exchange and books.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the top Peltier yard, which is highly respected at Nantes. Zuliani is a leading jumps jockey in France. Market support is significant, and connections are known for readying horses for these conditions. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Lolita Du Breuil (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in betting; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Grall’s runners are consistently competitive at this level. Mayeur is a capable rider with a good strike rate for the stable. Market position suggests stable confidence. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Galiako De Boulem (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in early markets; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Delaunay is a trainer to note at Nantes, and Vandamme is a reliable jockey booking. The horse is not dismissed by the market, indicating stable expectations. Connections have a history of success in similar contests.

shortlist.name: Caesar's Ransom (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.77 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as clear favourite suggests confidence from connections and punters. While the last run was only 7th, the odds indicate expected improvement and possible class edge. Top jockey booking is a positive.

shortlist.name: Fox On The Run (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite at 2.06, close to the top of the market.
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish shows current form and consistency. Well-supported in the market, suggesting connections expect another strong run. Trainer and jockey both reliable at this venue.

shortlist.name: Objet D' Art (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in the betting at 2.32, not far behind the top two.
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a 4th and 2nd, indicating progression and readiness. Market respect at single-figure odds. Top connections and a jockey in form add to appeal.

shortlist.name: Freedom Fighter (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.8 – clear market leader
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a strong second-place finish, indicating current form and readiness. Short odds reflect strong market confidence. Trainer and jockey both have solid local records. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Sliver Of Sunshine (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 3 – well-supported, close to favourite
shortlist.rationale: Recent fourth suggests competitiveness in similar company. Connections are respected at this venue. Odds indicate strong market support and realistic winning chance without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Umzingeli Wenyathi (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 3.25 – prominent in betting
shortlist.rationale: Consistently placed in recent starts, showing reliability and fitness. Market keeps this runner prominent, suggesting expectation of another strong run. No evidence of decline in form.

shortlist.name: Wedding Vow (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange favourite at 2.38
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as favourite, recent form suggests improvement with a 5th and 7th before a better run last time. Trainer is highly respected locally and the horse is likely peaking for this contest.

shortlist.name: Red State (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite at 2.78
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, indicating reliability at this level. Trainer has a solid record and the odds reflect strong market confidence. Should be competitive if reproducing latest efforts.

shortlist.name: Clouds Clearing (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid contender at 4.0
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with improving form figures and a top trainer in J. S. Snaith. Recent 4th suggests readiness to step forward, and odds offer reasonable value for a runner with upside.

shortlist.name: Viva La Vida (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.2, solid market support
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two consecutive wins and a recent second, indicating peak form and reliability. Connections are respected locally, and the odds suggest strong market confidence. No signs of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Berry's Boogie (Aus)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 1.77, well-backed favourite
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in last two starts before a break, showing clear winning ability. Trainer and jockey combination is notable for success at Durbanville. The odds reflect strong support and expectation for a top run.

shortlist.name: Wander Dune (Aus)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.44, competitive price
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win and a second, suggesting untapped potential and upward trajectory. Trainer is in form, and the odds indicate genuine market respect. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Avignon (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.14, joint market leader
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (last run '1'), indicating peak form and ability to win at this level. Trainer P. Botha is well represented in the race, suggesting stable confidence. No need for major improvement and offers value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Country Time (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.14, joint market leader
shortlist.rationale: Latest run was a win ('1'), showing current form and ability to compete at this class. Consistent profile with several recent placings. Trainer and jockey combination is reliable. Odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: Kaiboy (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 1.51 – clear market leader, strong support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, progressive profile with multiple recent wins and places; latest win confirms current peak form. Trainer and jockey are both reliable at this venue. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and align with form evidence.

shortlist.name: Mai Sensation (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 1.77 – well supported, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Three wins from last five starts, only narrowly beaten last time. Stable in excellent form and jockey is experienced. Recent form suggests the horse is holding condition and remains competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Arctic Wizard (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 1.77 – respected in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent placings indicate reliability and current well-being. Connections are capable, and the horse has shown adaptability in various race scenarios. Market support is justified by form.

shortlist.name: Queen Regent (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.77, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive recent form with two wins and a second in last three starts, suggesting peak condition. Trained by Snaith, a leading local stable, and well-backed in the market. Connections and form profile point to a top chance.

shortlist.name: Du Maurier (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.77, among the market leaders.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with two wins and two seconds in last five runs, showing reliability and class at this level. Trained by Bass, another top local yard, and market support is solid. Recent form and connections make this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Easy Money (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.77, indicating respect from the market.
shortlist.rationale: Placed in last two starts and regularly competitive, suggesting readiness to win. Trainer Botha is capable, and the horse's consistency at this level is notable. Odds reflect genuine winning chance.

shortlist.name: Nordic Quest (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 2.14, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings, proven ability at this class and distance, and top connections with Domeyer and Bass. No signs of decline and fitness appears optimal.

shortlist.name: Artiste (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 2.14, well-backed in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows steady improvement and strong placings, with a top jockey/trainer combination. Has demonstrated ability to compete at this level and is likely to be peaking.

shortlist.name: Papillon Blu (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 2.14, suggesting market confidence.
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form with three consecutive wins followed by a respectable fourth, indicating strong current condition and ability to handle the competition. Connections are in good form.

shortlist.name: October Storm (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: 1.01 exchange, clear market leader
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win and a recent second, showing rapid progression. Top jockey booked and strong connections. Market support is overwhelming, indicating high confidence from bettors and professionals.

shortlist.name: Churchillian (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: 1.77 exchange, solidly backed
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placings, including a win. Reliable connections and a top jockey. Profile fits for a horse ready to win again at this level.

shortlist.name: Azzurri (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: 1.77 exchange, well supported
shortlist.rationale: Multiple wins and frequent top-four finishes in recent starts. Trained by a leading yard and has shown ability to compete at this class. Odds indicate strong market respect.
